metadata.title: CVE-2021-20271 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in RPM's signature check functionality when reading apackage file. This flaw allows an attacker who can convince a victim toinstall a seemingly verifiable package, whose signature header wasmodified, to cause RPM database corruption and execute code. The highestthreat from this vulnerability is to data integrity, confidentiality, andsystem availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20271` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

librpm9t64 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
librpmbuild9t64 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
librpmio9t64 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
librpmsign9t64 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
python3-rpm - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm-common - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm-i18n - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm2cpio - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rpm package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.17.0+dfsg1-1').
